gurmukhi: b`kY mwrM ] c`kY cwrM ] s`jY SsqRM ] b`jY AsqRM ]224]
transliteration: Bakkai Maaran|| Chaaran|| Sajjai Shastran|| Bahhai Astran||224||
translation: They are shouting “kill, kill” in all the four directions and bedecking themselves, they are striking their weapons.224.
There are seen many warriors able to confront the very great power and there are also seen those in helpless condition.225.
The warriors are challenging and are consciously striking blows.226.
The warriors of Shiraz sat down after feeling shy.227.
Kalki inspires them to get up and cause them to see; he revolves the sword and strikes its edge.228.

gurmukhi: jhw qIr Cutq ] rx DIr jutq ] brbIr auTq ] qn qRwx Putq ]229]
transliteration: Jahaa Teer Chhoutat|| Ran Dheer Joutat|| Barbeer Outhat|| Tan Traan Phoutat||229||
translation: Where the warriors are fighting and the arrows are being discharged, there the warriors get up and their armours, being shattered are falling down.229.

gurmukhi: rx bIr igrq ] Bv isMD qrq ] nB hUr iPrq ] br bIr brq ]230]
transliteration: Ran Beer Girat|| Bhav Soundh Tarat|| Nabh Hoor Phirat|| Bar Beer Barat||230||
translation: The warriors falling down in the war-arena are ferrying across the ocean of fear and the heavenly damsels roaming in the sky, are wedding the warriors.230.

gurmukhi: rx nwd bjq ] sux BIr Bjq ] rx BUm qjq ] mn mwJ ljq ]231]
transliteration: Ran Naad Bajat|| Soun Bheer Bhajat|| Ran Bhoom Tajat|| Man Maajh Lajat||231||
translation: Listening to the musical instruments of the battlefield, the cowards are running away and abandoning the battlefield, they are feeling shy.231.

gurmukhi: iPr Pyr lrq ] rx ju`J mrq ] nh pwv trq ] Bv isMD qrq ]232]
transliteration: Phir Pher Larat|| Ran Jujjh Marat|| Nah Paav Tarat|| Bhav Sindh Tarat||232||
translation: The warriors are again rotating and embracing death by fighting; they do not retrace even one step from the battlefield and are ferrying across the dreadful ocean of Samsara by dying.232.

gurmukhi: rx rMg mcq ] cqurMg Ptq ] srbMg ltq ] mn mwn Gtq ]233]
transliteration: Ran Ran Machat|| Chaturan Phatat|| Sarban Latat|| Man Maan Ghatat||233||
translation: In the dreadful war, the fourfold army was scattered into fragments and because of the infliction of wounds on the bodies of the warriors, their honour and respect declined.233.

gurmukhi: br bIr iBrq ] nhI nYk iPrq ] jb ic`q icrq ] auT sYn iGrq ]234]
transliteration: Bar Beer Bhirat|| Nahi Naik Phirat|| Jah Chitt Chirat|| Outh Sain Ghirat||234||
translation: Without retracing their steps even slightly, the warriors are fighting and in anger, they are besieging the army.234.

gurmukhi: igr BUm prq ] sur nwr brq ] nhI pwv trq ] mn kop Brq ]235]
transliteration: Gir Bhoom Parat|| Sur Naar Barat|| Nahipaav Tarat|| Man Kop Bharat||235||
translation: They fall down on the earth after dying and the women of gods are wedding them; the warriors getting enraged in their mind, do not retrace even one step.235.
